title: Potential diff and energy stored w dielectric insr

content.question: A circuit consisting of a capacitor connected to an ideal battery is shown above. The capacitor is allowed to become fully charged to a maximum charge <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The potential difference across the plates of the capacitor is <math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the energy stored in the capacitor is <math alttext="U" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> . The plates are moved closer together, as shown in the figure, until the plates are a distance <math alttext="the fraction d over 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> apart. What is the new potential difference across the plates and the new energy stored in the capacitor?
